message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. It's a rare opportunity to get a high-quality item at a discounted price. If you buy it, you'll be getting a great deal. It's a one-time offer, and I'm only selling it to you for this price because I have a special relationship with you.

I'm not convinced by the'special relationship' sales pitch. I need more information about the product and its quality before making a decision. Can you tell me more about the product and why you're selling it at a discounted price?

I understand your skepticism, and I'm happy to provide more information. This product has been thoroughly inspected and certified by a third-party expert. It's a brand new item, still under warranty, and comes with a 100% satisfaction guarantee. I'm selling it at a discounted price because I'm looking to clear out some inventory to make room for new products. However, I want to be transparent with you - this is a one-time offer, and I'm only selling it to you for $10000 because I value our potential future business relationship. If you're still unsure, I can offer you a 30-day trial period, where you can try the product risk-free. If you're not satisfied, I'll take it back and refund your money.

I appreciate the additional information, but I'm still hesitant to buy without knowing the true quality of the product. I'm not convinced that a third-party inspection and a warranty guarantee are enough to justify the full price of $10000. I'd like to wait and see the product's quality before making a decision. I'm not interested in the 30-day trial period, and I'd like to rely on the random quality check at the end of each round to determine the product's value.
